history.proof: intros A B C H. qsimpl time: 1 use: isocele_permute. qsimpl time: 1 use: isocele_permute. srun best use: R_permute, symetrique unfold: isocele.

exceptions.exn: In environment A, B, C : PO H : isocele A B C The term "A" has type "PO" while it is expected to have type "isocele ?A ?B ?C".

In environment H0 : forall A B C : PO, isocele A B C -> R (plus (cons (vec A C) (vec A B)) (double (cons (vec B A) (vec B C)))) pi A, B, C : PO H : isocele A B C Unable to unify "R (plus (cons (vec ?M1506 ?M1508) (vec ?M1506 ?M1507)) (double (cons (vec ?M1507 ?M1506) (vec ?M1507 ?M1508)))) pi" with "R (cons (vec C B) (vec C A)) (cons (vec B A) (vec B C))".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall A B C : PO, isocele A B C -> isocele A C B

Premises:
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {
*** [ PO : Type ]
isocele = fun A B C : PO => R (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)) (cons (vec C A) (vec C B)) : PO -> PO -> PO -> Prop
triangle_isocele : forall A B C : PO, isocele A B C -> R (plus (cons (vec A B) (vec A C)) (double (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)))) pi
isocele_permute : forall A B C : PO, isocele A B C -> R (plus (cons (vec A C) (vec A B)) (double (cons (vec B A) (vec B C)))) pi
construction_circonscrit : forall M A B : PO, ~ colineaire (vec M A) (vec M B) -> exists O : PO, isocele O A B /\ isocele O A M /\ isocele O B M
unicite_circonscrit : forall M A B O O' : PO, isocele O A B -> isocele O M B -> isocele O M A -> isocele O' A B -> isocele O' M B -> isocele O' M A -> (colineaire (vec O A) (vec O' A) /\ colineaire (vec O B) (vec O' B)) /\ colineaire (vec O M) (vec O' M)
cocyclique : forall M A B O M' : PO, isocele O A B -> isocele O M A -> isocele O M B -> isocele O M' A -> isocele O M' B -> R (double (cons (vec M' A) (vec M' B))) (double (cons (vec M A) (vec M B)))
somme_triangle : forall A B C : PO, R (plus (cons (vec A B) (vec A C)) (plus (cons (vec B C) (vec B A)) (cons (vec C A) (vec C B)))) pi
circonscrit = fun M A B O : PO => isocele O A B /\ isocele O A M /\ isocele O B M : PO -> PO -> PO -> PO -> Prop
angle_inscrit : forall A B M O : PO, isocele O M A -> isocele O M B -> R (double (cons (vec M A) (vec M B))) (cons (vec O A) (vec O B))
tangente : forall A B O T : PO, isocele O A B -> orthogonal (vec A T) (vec O A) -> R (double (cons (vec A T) (vec A B))) (cons (vec O A) (vec O B))
tangente_reciproque : forall A B O T T' : PO, isocele O A B -> orthogonal (vec A T) (vec O A) -> R (double (cons (vec A T') (vec A B))) (cons (vec O A) (vec O B)) -> colineaire (vec A T) (vec A T')
opp_vect : forall A B : PO, vR (opp (vec A B)) (vec B A)
abba : forall A B : PO, R (cons (vec A B) (vec B A)) pi
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B Arguments prod (_ _)%type_scope Arguments pair {A B}%type_scope
sont_cocycliques = fun M A B M' : PO => exists O O' : PO, (circonscrit M A B O /\ circonscrit M' A B O') /\ colineaire (vec O A) (vec O' A) /\ colineaire (vec O B) (vec O' B) : PO -> PO -> PO -> PO -> Prop
construction_circonscrit_vecteur : forall M A B : PO, exists u v w : V, (R (cons u v) (double (cons (vec M A) (vec M B))) /\ R (cons u w) (double (cons (vec B A) (vec B M))) /\ R (cons v w) (double (cons (vec A B) (vec A M)))) /\ R (cons (vec A B) u) (cons v (vec B A)) /\ R (cons w (vec M B)) (cons (vec B M) v) /\ R (cons (vec M A) w) (cons u (vec A M))
v_vec : forall (u : V) (A : PO), exists B : PO, vR u (vec A B)
construction_isocele_base : forall (A B : PO) (a : AV), exists u v : V, R (cons (vec A B) u) (cons v (vec B A)) /\ R (cons u v) (double a)
non_vide_P : exists A : PO, A = A
ssrbool.if_expr : forall A : Type, bool -> A -> A -> A
BinNat.N.case_analysis : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A BinNums.N0 -> (forall n : BinNums.N, A (BinNat.N.succ n)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, A n
Field_theory.NPEmul : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Ring_polynom.mkPX : forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Field_theory.NPEpow : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> BinNums.N -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Ring_polynom.PEmul : forall C : Type, Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Ring_polynom.PEadd : forall C : Type, Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C

```coq
intros A B C H.
rewrite <- (isocele_permute A B C H).
apply isocele_permute.
Qed.
```

original: intros A B C H. rewrite <- (isocele_permute A B C H). apply isocele_permute.
